metadata.title: CVE-2017-5992 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Openpyxl 2.4.1 resolves external entities by default, which allows remote attackers to conduct XXE attacks via a crafted .xlsx document. It was discovered that openpyxl incorrectly handled certain documents. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

criterions.comment: openpyxl package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-1').
